content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I received a message with a Python code to generate a river map using the "arcgis" module, but it resulted in an error due to a missing module named "arcgis.gis". I used the "execute_shell" command to install the missing module by running the command "pip install arcgis". Following this, I received a message that the "execute_shell_popen" command was executed successfully and that the subprocess started with PID: '2687'. However, when I tried to execute the Python code to install "arcgis" using the "execute_python_code" command, it returned an error due to invalid syntax.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell_popen", "args": {"command_line": "pip install arcgis"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell_popen returned: Subprocess started with PID:'2786'", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_python_code", "args": {"code": "from arcgis.gis import GIS\\nfrom arcgis.mapping import WebMap\\n\\n# Connect to ArcGIS Online\\ngis = GIS(\\"https://www.arcgis.com\\", \\"username\\", \\"password\\")\\n\\n# Create a new web map\\nweb_map = WebMap()\\n\\n# Add a feature layer to the map\\nweb_map.add_layer({\\"type\\": \\"FeatureLayer\\", \\"url\\": \\"https://services.arcgis.com/V6ZHFr6zdgNZuVG0/arcgis/rest/services/USA_Rivers_and_Streams/FeatureServer/0\\"})\\n\\n# Save the web map\\nweb_map.save(item_properties={\\"title\\": \\"River Map\\", \\"snippet\\": \\"A map of rivers in the USA\\"})", "basename": "generate_river_map"}}}', type='ai_response')]
"""
